Authors:
ismail Acar, ayten Dizkirici, Aysenur Kalmer, Yusuf
Uzun
Title:
Understanding phylogenetic relationships and taxonomical
positions of three new records Melanoleuca species collected from
Hakkari province, Turkey
Keywords: ITS  LSU  Morphology  Melanoleuca  Phylogeny − TEF
Abstract:
The aim of the current study was to contribute to the
knowledge of the genus Melanoleuca in Turkey. Specimens collected from
Hakkâri province of Turkey were studied morphologically and
phylogenetically using a multi-gene sequence analysis. Pileus, lamellae,
stipe, spores, basidia and cystidia structures were used as
morphological characters and detailed macroscopic and microscopic
descriptions of the species were given. To figure out phylogenetic
positions of the species, DNA sequence data of the Internal Transcribed
Spacer (ITS), the Large Subunit (LSU) of the nuclear ribosomal RNA
(rRNA) gene complex and Translation Elongation Factor 1-α (TEF) regions
were analysed. At the end of the study, three new records species of
Melanoleuca (Melanoleuca communis, M.dryophila and M.heterocystidiosa)
were reported from Hakkâri province. Melanoleuca communis and
M.heterocystidiosa species were placed in subgenus Melanoleuca / section
Melanoleuca. Melanoleuca dryophila was separated from the other two
species and placed in subgenus Urticocytis when ITS and LSU regions were
analyzed. Considering the lack of information ofthis genus in Turkey and
the fact that no detailed study has been developed before, this work is
valuable to the systematics of Melanoleuca and to the taxonomic
knowledge of agarics in Turkey.
